metadata.title: CVE-2024-30205 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In Emacs before 29.3, Org mode considers contents of remote files to betrusted. This affects Org Mode before 9.6.23.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-30205` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

emacs - 1:26.3+1-1ubuntu2+esm1
emacs-bin-common - 1:26.3+1-1ubuntu2+esm1
emacs-common - 1:26.3+1-1ubuntu2+esm1
emacs-el - 1:26.3+1-1ubuntu2+esm1
emacs-gtk - 1:26.3+1-1ubuntu2+esm1
emacs-lucid - 1:26.3+1-1ubuntu2+esm1
emacs-nox - 1:26.3+1-1ubuntu2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: emacs package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:26.3+1-1ubuntu2+esm1').
xemacs21 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
xemacs21-packages package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
org-mode package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
